column1: When can electrical microshock occur? When:
column2: contact between the skin and the 240 V domestic supply results in a current greater than 100 milliamps.
column3: a conductor carrying a current greater than 1 microamp enters the body through the skin.
column4: a conductor carrying a current greater than 100 microamps enters the body through the skin.
column5: a current of 2 to 4 amps passes through the heart forcing it to clamp shut.

column1: How does accommodation in the eye occur? When our ciliary muscle
column2: contracts and the tension on the ciliary ﬁ bres increases allowing a rounder lens
column3: relaxes and the tension on the ciliary ﬁ bres decreases allowing a rounder lens
column4: relaxes and the pull of our ciliary ﬁ bres ﬂ attens the lens
column5: contracts and the pull of our ciliary ﬁ bres ﬂ attens the lens
